title: What time is Watchmen airing in the UK and how can you watch it?
text:
Watchmen is already proving a hit with viewers (Picture: HBO)

Watchmen has been one of the most anticipated new series of the year – and viewers are already obsessed after the pilot aired.

Many viewers called the episode ‘the best pilot’ they’ve ever seen – with star Regina King winning particular praise for her performance in the show.

Those viewers in the UK who managed to stay awake also had the chance to see it for themselves, as the pilot aired at 2am in a simulcast with HBO in the US.

Of course if you couldn’t stay up till the small hours you’ll have another chance to see it at a more civilised hour – but when’s it on and who’s showing it?

Here’s what you need to know…

What time is Watchmen on on Monday night and how can you watch it?

Watchmen is set to air on Monday night at 9pm.

Advertisement

It’s being shown on Sky Atlantic – as is common with a lot of shows produced by HBO – with the second episode due to simulcast on Sky Atlantic next Sunday night/Monday morning at 2am.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

The instalments will then be repeated at 9pm on Monday nights.

Alternatively you can catch the episode on Sky’s on demand streaming service, or via NOW TV.

What is Watchmen about?

The series is based on Alan Moore’s graphic novel (Picture: HBO)

The series is based on Alan Moore’s classic graphic novel of the same name, with the synopsis telling us: ‘Watchmen takes place in an alternative, contemporary reality in the United States, in which masked vigilantes became outlawed due to their violent methods.

‘Despite this, some gather around in order to start a revolution while others are out to stop it before it is too late, as a greater question rises above them all; who watches the Watchmen?’

Who is in the cast of Watchmen?

Regina King leads the cast as Detective Angela Abar – aka Sister Night, joined by co-star Tim Blake Nelson (O Brother Where Art Thou?) as her detective partner, Looking Glass.

Other cast members include Don Johnson (Miami Vice, Django Unchained) as Chief Judd Crawford and Yahya Abdul-Mateen II (Black Mirror) as Angela’s husband Cal.

The series also features Jean Smart, Louis Gossett Jr, Adelaide Clemens, James Wolk and Jeremy Irons.
